snippet: At a time of rising tensions in Europe over the increase in the Muslim population, some lauded the decision as an advance for religious freedom.
abstract: German Federal Constitutional Court rules that female Muslim teachers may wear head scarves in school, overturning 2003 decision that led several German states to pass laws banning headcovers for educators.

byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: At a time of rising tensions in Europe over the increase in the Muslim population, some lauded the decision as an advance for religious freedom.

headline.main: Muslim Teachers May Wear Head Scarves, German Court Rules
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Germany: Ruling for Muslim Teachers
